page.title: 03GUN HILL - BURNHAM OVERY
page.content: Gun Hill is the only labelled feature of land in the immediate vicinity. It is a large sand dune on the line of sand dunes along the coast. Maps indicate that the Hill is on the East point of the Harbour entrance, but in 1985 it is about 100 metres to the East. There exist photographs to show that the Hill, made of loose sand, has moved Eastwards under the action of the strong North-Westerly winds over the years, although there have been recent attempts to stabilise it. The Hill appears to owe its name to the suggestion that a Gun was mounted here to protect the Harbour Entrance. The dunes in the area are almost totally clear now although in the 1920's and 30's many chalets and huts housed a summer community, serviced by ferries from Overy Staithe.
